results.title: On the river: Thailand
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation and Soerabaia Pictures
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Kids next door”.
Shows the lifestyle of one Thai family on a large riverboat in Thailand. Also indicates the role of the river as a highway and the human habitation along the riverside. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: South Australian Film Corporation and Soerabaia Pictures

results.title: Lisa makes the headlines
results.creator_credit: Kit Hood, Linda Schuyler and Playing With Time
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Kids of Degrassi Street”.
Lisa’s newspaper isn’t selling very well. When Ida, one of her friends is robbed, Lisa thinks she is onto a scoop. However she comes to realise that she has to get her facts straight before she can write a good story. From the television series.

results.title: Meo Village: Preparing food
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Kids next door”.
Looks at a particular Meo village and shows the types of food eaten, the way in which it is grown and how it is prepared.

results.title: Cookie goes to hospital
results.creator_credit: Kit Hood, Linda Schuyler and Playing With Time
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Kids of Degrassi Street”.
The kids of DeGrassi Street find themselves involved in another adventure when Cookie suddenly takes ill during a club meeting and is sent to hospital to have her appendix removed. Cookie is apprehensive of her first visit to hospital and asks her friends to get her doll from the club house. Provides an insight into hospital routines and operational procedures.

results.title: Jelly-like, worm-like and colonial invertebrates
results.creator_credit: Dennis Sawyer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Intertidal Life of the North American Pacific Coast”.
This film covers various invertebrates living on the shores of British Columbia. Included are jellyfish, anemones, worms and the colonial bryozoans.

results.title: The Echinoderms
results.creator_credit: Dennis Sawyer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Intertidal Life of the North American Pacific Coast”.
A few species of the phylum Echinodermata found in the rich environment of the North American Pacific coast are shows. Four of the five classes are found in the inter-tidal region: Asteroidea, sea-stars; Ophiuroidea, brittle stars; Holothuriodea, sea cucumbers; and Echinoidea, sea-urchins. Uses micro-photogpraphy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dennis Sawyer and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Molluscs
results.creator_credit: Dennis Sawyer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Intertidal Life of the North American Pacific Coast”.
The marine fauna of the British Columbian coast is extremely diverse. The more common animals of the phylum molluscs from the classes Amphineura, Gastropoda, Pelecypoda, Cephalopoda are illustrated. Shows their size, habitat and feeding habits. Industrialisation and pollution have led to the destruction of many molluscs.

results.title: Samoa: I can get another wife but I can't get any parents
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Human face of the Pacific”.
This film is one of a series that examines the Pacific Islands and the conflict, within them, between the modern world and traditional lifestyles. The film looks at ancient customs in Western Samoa as well as the social problems of the present such as overpopulation and unemployment that force thousands of Samoans overseas in search of a better life. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Fiji - legacies of empire
results.creator_credit: Philip Robertson, Dennis O'Rourke, Cinema Enterprises and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Human face of the Pacific”.
This series looks at the Pacific islands, the traditions associated with them and issues that pose problems to them. This particular film examines the different aspects of life in Fiji. It notes the opinions of a patriarch of the hard-working Indian population and explores the co-existence of Hindus and Moslems who own less than a fifth of the land. Camera by Dennis O’Rourke and Joe Pickering.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Philip Robertson, Dennis O’Rourke, Cinema Enterprises and Film Australia
